uno.cards

Class UNO_Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • uno.cards.UNO_Card
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<UNO_Card>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Action_Card, Face_Card

    public class UNO_Card
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<UNO_Card>
    The UNO_Card class provides the base class for all UNO cards. Both face card and action card classes are derived from this class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UNO_Card

        public UNO_Card(int clr)
        Constructor for an UNO_Card of the specified color. This constructor constructs a base card. Cards for game play should be constructed using one of the classes Face_Card or Action_Card
        Parameters:
        clr - The color of the card.

    • Method Detail

      • getColor

        public int getColor()
        This method returns the color of the card. Possible colors are UNO_Card.BLUE, UNO_Card.RED, UNO_Card.GREEN, UNO_Card.YELLOW, and UNO_Card.BLACK.
        Returns:
        The color of the card.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(UNO_Card other)
        This method allows two cards to be compared. The cards are equal if they are the same color. Otherwise, they are unequal.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<UNO_Card>
        Parameters:
        other - The UNO card to compare with this card.
        Returns:
        0 if the cards are the same color; otherwise, 1.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method returns a string describing the card.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String describing the card.

      • getColorAsString

        protected java.lang.String getColorAsString()
        getColorAsString returns the color of the card as a string object.
        Returns:
        The color of the card as a String.
